intro: Ribes californicum subsp. hesperium, commonly known as the western gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to western North America. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, yellow-orange berries. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland and streamside habitats. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces upright, slender stems. The berries are edible, though often tart, and are used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
